Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

JPL is seeking a Public Engagement Specialist for Earth science communications who will:

  • Work with a team of dedicated communication professionals in producing forwarding thinking communication campaigns & products through collaboration, consensus building, creative innovation and appropriate senior management review, to serve NASA’s Earth science communications activities and the JPL Earth Public Engagement team.

  • Develop and lead engagement and communications plans, strategies, campaigns, and products on behalf of NASA Earth missions. 

  • Partner closely with subject matter experts (SMEs) and various teams of communicators to develop and implement comprehensive communications and engagement campaigns and activities.

  • Work with multiple subject matter experts (SMEs) across JPL’s Earth Science missions, distilling complex technical information into impactful and innovative communications proposals and products to engage and inspire.

  • Lead, motivate, clearly brief and collaborate with content development teams on communications requirements and messaging including events, branding and digital engagement.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop Public Engagement strategy and measurable goals for communicating on behalf of NASA missions.

  • Develop proactive stakeholder engagement strategy.

  • Research industry trends and provide ongoing improvements to public engagement campaigns, events and products to effectively communicate a message that aligns with NASA’s communications priorities, and engages the public.

  • Identify gaps and opportunities for communications products, suggest ongoing improvements for shaping communication products, activities, and campaigns with significant and far-ranging impact on the public and on NASA’s Earth science communications strategy.

  • Work with senior management and technical programs; help execute contracts.

  • Report metrics and progress against strategic goals.

  • Work closely with various teams to develop coordinated, unified communications strategy and approach.

  • Accountable for team results on projects and assignments, including performance standards, budget and schedule.

  • Inspire and engage the public in NASA Earth related activities; to support the social media and digital presence, improving impact, especially as it relates to Earth science and technology and global climate change.

  • Support NASA's communications priorities with content that is focused, relevant and timely.

  • Plan and execute innovative and high-visibility communication products for general audiences, focusing on NASA data.

  • Maintain factual accuracy of content focusing on NASA data.

  • Develop engaging communications campaigns, products, and activities in partnership with various stakeholders across the NASA Communications landscape.

  • Envision communications strategies, propose ideas and plans, present to the Earth Public Engagement Manager.

  • Represent JPL/NASA communication initiatives at professional conferences when necessary, including presenting papers and posters as a professional communicator.

  • Gather metrics and report on program impacts and make informed suggestions for improvements.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelors degree in Communications, Public Administration, Business Administration, Business Development/Management, Science/Technology, Marketing, Economics, or similar degree with a minimum of with 9 years of related experience; Masters with 7 years of related experience; PhD with 5 years of related experience

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills including effective presentation skills.

  • Consistent track record producing and delivering high impact events, experiences and products.

  • Demonstrated experience working collaboratively with a wide variety of stakeholders and will be skilled at synthesizing multiple points of view to reach consensus.

  • Experience working with senior level partners handling a variety of strategic and budgetary issues.

  • Ability to establish partnerships with partners and work well in a team environment.

  • Must work well in team environment as both a leader and participant.

  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint)

Preferred Skills: 

  • Prior experience working effectively with multiple government and NASA stakeholders strongly preferred.

  • Current on relevant industry, economic, governmental issues that should be reflected in or referenced in communications.

  • Previous public outreach and communications experience, especially within NASA environment and Earth/Climate communications highly desirable.

  • Experience in supporting senior leadership highly desirable.

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
